titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3009) to extend the Andean Trade Preference Act, to grant additional trade benefits under that Act, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-293, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3009 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 97.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 289.
DEBATE - The House resumed debate on H. Res. 289.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 225 - 191 (Roll no. 446).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/16/2001--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 3009 (Andean trade promotion and drug eradication).
